CatDescriptText: Georgia Hoover, student, Peters Township and Beverly White, student, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question "What are the most appealing nad the least appealing aspects of Republican presidential candidate Richard M. Nixon?"  Ms. Hoover's answer reads: "The most appealing is the fact that he's a Republican.  I don't think that he has any flaws but is just an ideal candidate." Ms. White's answer reads: "I like the way Nixon backs up Ike.  He carries his responsibilities well.  However, I have not as yet, studied his civil rights views."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Georgia Hoover wearing sunglasses and "I'm for Nixon" button, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Beverly White wearing light colored tank top with tied straps and plaid skirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
